channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Divers Recover 5th Body After Sinking of Yacht Off Sicily
item.description: The discovery leaves just one more person missing after the vessel went down this week carrying 10 crew members and 12 passengers, including the Briti...

item.title: Taxpayers and tech companies will help fund journalism and AI research in landmark California deal
item.description: The initiatives are set to kick in in 2025 with $100 million the first year, and the majority of the money would go to news organizations.

item.title: Lynch Yacht Sinking Off Sicily Proves as Baffling as It Is Tragic
item.description: As bodies were recovered, the authorities and experts wondered how a $40 million, stable and secure vessel could have sunk so quickly.

item.title: German Shell whistleblower says Chinese emission reduction oilfield was actually a chicken farm
item.description: Dozens of carbon reduction schemes in China are alleged to be fake, leaving Germany with a potential $5 billion fraud case.

item.title: Kennedy Is Expected to Drop Out, and Revised Data Shows Job Market Cracks
item.description: Plus, the Mennonites making the Amazon home.

item.title: Nvidia’s Jensen Huang sells $14 million in stock almost daily—raising questions about his successor
item.description: "Stop giving him stock. He's clearly got too much and that's why he's getting rid of it."

item.title: This $1,700 cult bassinet just added a $20 monthly subscription—and parents are fuming

item.title: The future could be bright for Irish wine as long as climate change warms up its cool climate
item.description: So far Ireland has been shielded from dramatic impacts of climate change like wildfires, drought and death, helping its nascent wine industry.
